insights: The new Mahindra Thar has made off-roaders mainstream, with over 75,000 people putting their money down on one since its launch last year.
The Gurkha has a more angular and rugged design, while the Thar has a more rounded and Wrangler-like appearance.
The Thar has a more spacious interior, with a wider footwell and larger seats, but the Gurkha has a more premium feel with nicer plastics and unique elements.
The Thar has a more practical rear seat, with easier access and more space for passengers and luggage, but the Gurkha has a more generous amount of headroom and legroom.
The Mahindra Thar has a more powerful engine, with 130 HP and 300 Nm, compared to the Gurkha's 91 HP and 250 Nm, but the Gurkha's engine is shared with Force's commercial vehicles.
The Thar has a more comfortable ride on the open road, but the Gurkha is better suited for off-road driving and has a more rugged design.
The Gurkha has a more advanced infotainment system, with a Kenwood touchscreen and steering-mounted controls, but the Thar has a more user-friendly interface and better connectivity options.
The Thar has a more spacious cargo area, with a larger luggage compartment and more room for passengers, but the Gurkha has a more premium feel and nicer plastics.
